description: Create Amazon Web Services service usage that you want to model in a Bill Scenario.

parameters.name: billScenarioId
parameters.description: The ID of the Bill Scenario for which you want to create the modeled usage.

parameters.name: usageModifications
parameters.description: List of usage that you want to model in the Bill Scenario. (dict) --- Represents an entry in a batch operation to create bill scenario usage modifications. The Amazon Web Services service code for this usage modification. This identifies the specific Amazon Web Services service to the customer as a unique short abbreviation. For example, AmazonEC2 and AWSKMS. Describes the usage details of the usage line item. The specific operation associated with this usage modification. Describes the specific Amazon Web Services operation that this usage line models. For example, RunInstances indicates the operation of an Amazon EC2 instance. availabilityZone (string) --- The Availability Zone that this usage line uses. A unique identifier for this entry in the batch operation. This can be any valid string. This key is useful to identify errors associated with any usage entry as any error is returned with this key. group (string) --- An optional group identifier for the usage modification. The Amazon Web Services account ID to which this usage will be applied to. amounts (list) --- The amount of usage you want to create for the service use you are modeling. (dict) --- Represents a usage amount for a specific time period. The start hour of the usage period. The usage amount for the period. historicalUsage (dict) --- Historical usage data associated with this modification, if available. The Amazon Web Services service code associated with the usage. The type of usage. The specific operation associated with the usage. location (string) --- The location associated with the usage. The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the usage. The time interval for the historical usage data. start (datetime) --- The start date and time of the interval. end (datetime) --- The end date and time of the interval. An optional filter expression to apply to the historical usage data. and (list) --- A list of expressions to be combined with AND logic. (dict) --- Represents a complex filtering expression for cost and usage data. or (list) --- A list of expressions to be combined with OR logic. not (dict) --- An expression to be negated. costCategories (dict) --- Filters based on cost categories. key (string) --- The key or attribute to filter on. matchOptions (list) --- The match options for the filter (e.g., equals, contains). (string) --- values (list) --- The values to match against. (string) --- dimensions (dict) --- Filters based on dimensions (e.g., service, operation). (string) --- tags (dict) --- Filters based on resource tags. (string) ---

nested_params.name: serviceCode
nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services service code for this usage modification. This identifies the specific Amazon Web Services service to the customer as a unique short abbreviation. For example, AmazonEC2 and AWSKMS.

nested_params.name: usageType
nested_params.description: Describes the usage details of the usage line item.

nested_params.name: operation
nested_params.description: The specific operation associated with this usage modification. Describes the specific Amazon Web Services operation that this usage line models. For example, RunInstances indicates the operation of an Amazon EC2 instance.

nested_params.name: availabilityZone
nested_params.description: The Availability Zone that this usage line uses.

nested_params.name: key
nested_params.description: A unique identifier for this entry in the batch operation. This can be any valid string. This key is useful to identify errors associated with any usage entry as any error is returned with this key.

nested_params.name: group
nested_params.description: An optional group identifier for the usage modification.

nested_params.name: usageAccountId
nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID to which this usage will be applied to.

nested_params.name: amounts
nested_params.description: The amount of usage you want to create for the service use you are modeling.

nested_params.name: startHour
nested_params.description: The start hour of the usage period.

nested_params.name: amount
nested_params.description: The usage amount for the period.

nested_params.name: historicalUsage
nested_params.description: Historical usage data associated with this modification, if available.

nested_params.name: serviceCode
nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services service code associated with the usage.

nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the usage.

nested_params.description: The start date and time of the interval.

nested_params.name: end
nested_params.description: The end date and time of the interval.

nested_params.name: filterExpression
nested_params.description: An optional filter expression to apply to the historical usage data.

nested_params.description: The values to match against.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: items
nested_items.description: Returns the list of successful usage line items that were created for the Bill Scenario.

nested_items.name: serviceCode
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services service code for this usage modification.

nested_items.name: usageType
nested_items.description: The type of usage that was modified.

nested_items.name: operation
nested_items.description: The specific operation associated with this usage modification.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: The location associated with this usage modification.

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The availability zone associated with this usage modification, if applicable.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier assigned to the created usage modification.

nested_items.name: group
nested_items.description: The group identifier for the created usage modification.

nested_items.name: usageAccountId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the created usage modification.

nested_items.name: quantities
nested_items.description: The modified usage quantities.

nested_items.name: startHour
nested_items.description: The start hour of the usage period.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: The unit of measurement for the usage quantity.

nested_items.name: amount
nested_items.description: The numeric value of the usage quantity.

nested_items.name: historicalUsage
nested_items.description: Historical usage data associated with this modification, if available.

nested_items.name: errors
nested_items.description: Returns the list of errors reason and the usage item keys that cannot be created in the Bill Scenario.

nested_items.description: The key of the entry that caused the error.

nested_items.description: A descriptive message for the error that occurred.

nested_items.description: The error code associated with the failed operation.
